item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, October 6, 2024 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. The Medieval Masterpiece, the Book of Kells, Now Digitized and Available Online (68 points | 20 comments)
2. Whence '\N'? (56 points | 16 comments)
3. When Earth Had Rings (66 points | 28 comments)
4. Life, death, and retirement (218 points | 75 comments)
5. HPy – A better C API for Python (196 points | 70 comments)
6. Trellis (YC W24) is hiring eng to build AI workflows for unstructured data ( | hide)
7. Wi-Fi Goes Long Range on New WiLo Standard (55 points | 12 comments)
8. Imagining faces in tree trunks and your morning eggs? AI can see them, too (40 points | 23 comments)
9. Mathematical Writing Style Guide for Stanford EE 364B [pdf] (2014) (61 points | 12 comments)

13. Meta Is Probably Training AI on Images Taken by Meta Ray-Bans (65 points | 34 comments)
14. Distributed Transactions in Go: Read Before You Try (74 points | 32 comments)
15. So thieves broke into your storage unit again (171 points | 142 comments)
16. Pine martens return to Dartmoor after 150-year absence (68 points | 29 comments)
17. Gokapi: Lightweight selfhosted Firefox Send alternative with AWS S3 support (88 points | 27 comments)
18. Let the network tell you where you are: a nerd snipe story (38 points | 11 comments)
19. WiFi4EU initiative provides free Wi-Fi in public spaces across Europe (81 points | 73 comments)
20. The Remarkable Life of Ibelin (281 points | 106 comments)

22. CoRncrete: A corn starch based building material (2017) (146 points | 100 comments)
23. Sometimes the product innovation is the distribution (105 points | 26 comments)
24. Show HN: Brisa Framework – Unifying server and client using the Web Platform (90 points | 59 comments)
25. What is the history of the use of "foo" and "bar" in source code examples? (2012) (129 points | 127 comments)
26. Show HN: Gato Prompt Lang – keep prompt content and responses short in JSON (11 points | 2 comments)
27. Statisticians use a technique that leverages randomness to deal with the unknown (128 points | 47 comments)
28. An Intuitive Explanation of Black–Scholes (193 points | 78 comments)
29. The Globus INK: a mechanical navigation computer for Soviet spaceflight (2023) (186 points | 25 comments)
30. One pioneering grizzly and her two cubs appear on Vancouver Island (102 points | 56 comments)
